Package client.controller

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • client.controller.Client
  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    Client class for playing the Tool Shop inventory system.
    Since:
    March 20, 2019
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nick Park and Carter Shaul

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private MainMenu menu
      The MainMenu object which is displayed to the client.
      private GUIController menuController
      The GUIController object which manages all client interaction with the MainMenu
      private java.net.Socket socket
      The Socket object which is the endpoint for the communication with the server.
      private java.io.BufferedReader socketIn
      The BufferedReader object which reads the socket input stream to receive data from the server.
      private java.io.PrintWriter socketOut
      The PrintWriter object which writes to the socket output stream to communicate with the server.
      private java.io.BufferedReader stdIn
      The BufferedReader object which reads user input.

    • Constructor Summary

      Client​(java.lang.String serverName, int portNumber, MainMenu frame)
      Constructs a Client for a Server with the specified server name and port.

      • Client

        public Client​(java.lang.String serverName,
              int portNumber,
              MainMenu frame)
        Constructs a Client for a Server with the specified server name and port.
        Parameters:
        serverName - name of the Server to be connected to
        portNumber - port number of the Server to be connected to
        frame - the graphical interface the user is interacting with

    • Method Detail

      • communicateWithServer

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> communicateWithServer()
        Gets input from the user, sends the input to the Server, and prints out the response from the Server.
        Returns:
        the response from the server as an ArrayList of Strings

      • getSocketOut

        public java.io.PrintWriter getSocketOut()
        Gets the handle on the output PrintWriter object.
        Returns:
        The PrintWriter object used to output information to the socket.
